casebody.data:
Sutro et al., Respondents, v. Manhattan Ry. Co. et al., Appellants. (Superior Court of New York City, General Term. January 11, 1892.) Appeal from special term. Action by Emanuel S. Sutro and another against the Manhattan Railway Company and the Metropolitan Elevated Railroad Company for an injunction to restrain the maintenance and operation of defendants’ railroad in the street abutting plaintiffs’ premises and for damages.

Argued before Freedman, MoAdam, and Gildersleeve, JJ.

Davies, Short <& Townsend, (Edward B. Thomas, of counsel,) for appellants. Peokham & Tyler, (E. W. Tyler and E. A. Hibbard, of counsel,) for respondents. Per Curiam.

The judgment should be affirmed, with costs.
